issues.description: Mismatch in messageOnMilk method signature: the problem statement and UML define messageOnMilk() with no parameters, but the solution’s Milkable interface and implementing classes use messageOnMilk(double volume). This conflict will confuse students and prevent them from matching the intended interface.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the specification by changing the interface and implementations to use messageOnMilk() without parameters: remove the double volume parameter from the Milkable interface and all implementing classes.

issues.description: The problem statement’s UML defines the Milkable interface with a parameterless method messageOnMilk():String (lines 51–53 in problem_statement.md), but the solution repository’s Milkable.java declares messageOnMilk(double volume) (lines 3–5). Seal.java and Goat.java likewise implement messageOnMilk(double). This discrepancy in method signature (addition of a volume parameter) conflicts with the problem instructions and template guidance, creating confusion about which signature students should implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the problem statement and template to specify a volume parameter for messageOnMilk or remove the parameter from the solution’s Milkable interface and its implementations so that messageOnMilk() has the same parameterless signature across all artifacts.
